To determine the ERC standard used by a specific piece of code, one would typically look for specific function signatures or interfaces that match those defined in an ERC standard. title: Token Distribution
description: Check the token distribution mechanisms.
whitepaper: The MKR token is used as a recapitalization resource of the Maker Protocol, where new MKR tokens may be minted and sold in a Debt Auction to recapitalize the system if the system debt exceeds the surplus. This mechanism incentivizes MKR holders to govern the system responsibly. The conclusion is that the MKR token distribution mechanism includes minting new tokens for recapitalization through Debt Auctions.
code: The MKR token is primarily distributed through a Debt Auction mechanism to recapitalize the Maker system when necessary. MKR holders are responsible for governing the Maker ecosystem, which includes voting on risk parameters and system upgrades to maintain the system's stability and avoid excessive risk-taking. The token does not have a traditional reward or staking system but is used as a governance token and a recapitalization resource. The conclusion is that the MKR token distribution is tightly linked to its governance and system sustainability functions, with Debt Auctions being a key distribution mechanism in times of system debt exceeding the surplus.
